intro: Prangos szowitsii, commonly known as the Afghan fennel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to fennel. Prangos szowitsii is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate white flowers and feathery leaves.
